title: Sri Lanka fuel queue claims first death: report
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A person waiting in a queue to buy kerosene (paraffin) in the central Sri Lanka district of Kandy has died after collapsing, a media report said.
Sri Lanka’s Sirasa television said the 71 year old person was believed to be a resident of Wattegama, off Kandy.
The report broadcast comments of a by-stander saying the person had collapsed while in the queue and police had called an ambulance and taken the person to hospital.
Sri Lanka is facing a fuel crisis after forex shortages were caused by money printed to keep interest rates low in a bid to build a ‘production economy.’ (Colombo/Mar20/2022)
